title: Can Cheap Money Entice Growth In Small Cap Stocks?
text: A growing worry of stagflation (high inflation followed by stagnant economic growth) is becoming more of a trending reality as the pandemic looks to continue into the next year.  The March selloff affected major global supply chains and if paired with rising inflation, could create an even tougher environment for smaller businesses to survive or […] The post Can Cheap Money Entice Growth In Small Cap Stocks?

title: Wall Street banks see rare payday bonanza in India despite pandemic
text: Major Wall Street banks in India raked in their second-highest fee income since the global financial crisis in the first nine months of this year, benefitting from a flurry of private-sector deals despite the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Economic Report: Stimulus stalemate threatens more hardship and slower recovery, economists warn
text: The failure of Washington to deliver another big dose of stimulus before the election probably won't tip the U.S. back into recession, economists say, but the lapse in aid threatens to destroy more businesses, inflict greater pain on millions of unemployed Americans and drag out a recovery.

title: Dow ends lower Wednesday as reports signal lack of will to strike coronavirus fiscal package before Election Day
text: U.S. stock benchmarks finished lower on Wednesday amid a failure to produce any fresh developments on the negotiations to carve out additional fiscal support for American workers and businesses. The Dow Jones Industrial Average [: DJIA] finished the session off nearly 100 points, or 0.4%, at 28,201, on a preliminary basis.

title: Both sides in Washington play down Election Day as fiscal stimulus deal deadline
text: Both House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and a White House official downplayed the significance of a vote on another fiscal stimulus deal by Nov. 3, increasing the odds it will slip into the post-election lame duck session of Congress, which starts Nov. 9 for the Senate and Nov. 16 for the House.

title: More money flowing into hedge funds amid global unrest
text: For the first time in more than two years, more money is flowing into hedge funds than is being pulled out of them as smart-money investors look to protect themselves from growing uncertainty around the world. The third quarter of 2020 saw net inflows of $13 billion for the hedge fund industry as a whole,.

text: Reverse mergers were long reserved to the backwaters of Wall Street. Today, they've become the hottest way to go public.

title: As U.S. election odds narrow, market analysts factor in higher risks
text: A higher risk of a split U.S. Congress and a contested election is being factored into some market analysts' models after some odds on the Presidential election have shown a narrowing.

title: Economic Report: Fed's Beige Book finds limited pace of economic growth in early October
text: Most regions of the country said economic growth was 'slight to modest,' according to the latest Beige Book report released by the Federal Reserve on Wednesday.

title: Stock Bulls Need A Shock Stimulus To Revive The Rally
text: Cyclical value stocks have outperformed growth companies, the Russell 2000 is beating the Nasdaq, the 10-year yield is higher, and reopening trades are mostly unchanged.

title: U.S. economic recovery slow and modest, but some sectors struggling: Fed survey
text: The U.S. economy continued to recover at a slight to modest pace through early October as consumers bought homes and increased spending, but the picture varied greatly from sector to sector, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday.

title: Federal Reserve's Lael Brainard says more fiscal stimulus is needed to help the economy
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung reports on Lael Brainard and Cleveland Fed President Loretta J. Mester commenting on the need for more fiscal stimulus to help the economy.

title: Greenspan: Productivity Decline Signals Slower Growth Ahead
text: Oct.21 -- Former Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan says productivity growth has slowed "very dramatically," suggesting slower U.S. economic growth in the intermediate term. He speaks during an interview with Bloomberg's David Westin on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: The Cost of Going to Cash
text: Earlier this year many investors panicked and fled to cash when news of Covid-19 caused a sharp downturn in the first quarter. While market downturns are common, there was no playbook for a global pandemic.

title: Insana: Kudlow is wrong, this is not a V-shaped recovery
text: Those who are suggesting that a strong economic rebound is underway in the U.S. are overlooking a very obvious phenomenon.

title: In One Chart: Stock-market volatility can surge by 20% in the 2 weeks prior to Election Day—but don't act rash
text: Wells Fargo Investment Institute's Chao Ma, global portfolio and investment strategist, highlights a chart that shows the degree to which expectations for volatility can swing higher in the lead-up to U.S. Election Day, with just about two weeks to go.

title: How to invest ahead of the 2020 election, according to top advisors
text: Infrastructure, renewable energy and technology stocks will be among the big winners with a potential Biden win. On the flipside, defense and financial stocks with benefit under a Trump administration, experts say.

title: Blue Wave Could Bring ‘Significant' Rate Moves: Raymond James' Giddis
text: Oct.21 -- Raymond James Chief Fixed Income Strategist Kevin Giddis says bond markets may not be prepared for the “growth and inflation” story from a Democratic sweep in the 2020 election and sees value in the muni market no matter which party wins the House and Senate. He speaks on “Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: In One Chart: Stocks are rallying when the U.S. dollar falls and falling when the dollar rallies
text: Don't believe a weaker dollar is good news for stock-market bulls? The inverse correlation between the currency and the S&P 500 index is running high, note analysts at Bespoke Investment Group.

title: Opinion: Why the US economy won't gain any traction until 2021
text: This has been a rotten year, and any chance of it ending on a high note has faded. The Covid-19 pandemic is intensifying, rancor over the US presidential election is mounting, and lawmakers haven't come to terms on another fiscal rescue package to shore up the fragile economy. It is difficult to see how the economy will be able to gain any traction until next year when the pandemic and election are hopefully in the history books.
